1.text: Jesus was then led by the Spirit [to go] into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

2.text: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, Jesus was hungry.

3.text: The tempter came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”

4.text: But Jesus answered, “It is written:  One shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes out of the mouth of God!”

5.text: Then the devil took him to the holy city. He placed him on the pinnacle of the temple

6.text: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you’ and [also],  They will carry you in their hands,   so that you may not dash your foot against a stone.

7.text: Jesus replied, “But it is also written, ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”

8.text: The devil took him to an extremely high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

9.text: The devil said to Jesus, “I will give you all of these things if you will fall down and express adoration to me.”

10.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall express adoration to the Lord your God, and to him only shall you offer divine service.’”

11.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and ministered to him.

12.text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.

13.text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,

14.text: so that what had been spoken through Isaias (Isaiah) the prophet might be fulfilled:

15.text: The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,   toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

16.text: the people who sat in darkness saw a great light,   to those who sat in the region and shadow of death,   to them light has dawned.

17.text: From that time on, Jesus began to preach and to say, “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”

18.text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, Jesus saw two brothers: Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother. They were casting a net into the sea since they were fishermen.

19.text: He said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fish for people!”

20.text: Immediately, they left their nets and followed him.

21.text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. Jesus called them.

22.text: At once, they left the boat and their father, and followed him.

23.text: Jesus traveled throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing all kinds of diseases and sickness among the people.

24.text: His fame spread into all Syria, and they brought him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, people possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

25.text: Great crowds from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.
